title: Everyday English Course 59
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: Where are they talking?

answerOptions: He will go in spite of the cold weather.
He won't go since he is not feeling well.
He will go when he feels better.
instances.correctAnswer: He won't go since he is not feeling well.

variables.a: Will the man go dancing with the woman tonight?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Please turn on the air conditioner. The temperature is 39°C today.
M: All right. But I think it might be cooler outside at this time of the day. Many people are doing their morning exercises outdoors now.
W: What do you mean?
M: I suggest you do the same.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Please turn on the air conditioner. The temperature is 39°C today.
M: All right. But I think it might be cooler outside at this time of the day. Many people are doing their morning exercises outdoors now.
W: What do you mean?
M: I suggest you do the same.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: Please turn on the air conditioner. The temperature is 39°C today.
M: All right. But I think it might be cooler outside at this time of the day. Many people are doing their morning exercises outdoors now.
W: What do you mean?
M: I suggest you do the same.
{a}

answerOptions: The man suggested that the woman stay indoors in the morning.
The man suggested that the woman go outdoors in the morning.
The man suggested that the woman stay indoors in the evening.
instances.correctAnswer: The man suggested that the woman go outdoors in the morning.

variables.a: What did the man suggest the woman do?
Where did the man think he could find the woman?

answerOptions: He can't help move the cupboard.
He hesitates whether to help or not.
He'll help if the woman doesn't mind.
instances.correctAnswer: He can't help move the cupboard.

variables.a: What does the man mean?
What can we learn about the box from the dialogue?
What did they likely do just now?

answerOptions: He can't afford to go traveling yet.
His trip to Hawaii was not enjoyable.
He usually checks his brakes before a trip.
instances.correctAnswer: He can't afford to go traveling yet.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: What are you doing this evening?
M: Well, I've got a lot of work to do. I ought to stay at home and study, really.
W: Oh, come on. It's Saturday.
M: Well, how about going to the cinema, then?
W: There is nothing on that I want to see.
M: Oh, all right. Well, we could rent a video and watch that.
W: Neither of us has a video player.
M: No. But Tony's got a new DVD player. How about renting a movie to watch with him at his place?
W: Oh, that's a great idea.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:

M: Well, I've got a lot of work to do. I ought to stay at home and study, really.

W: Oh, that's a great idea.
{a}

variables.a: Two people are talking. What do they decide to do this evening?

answerOptions: Take the medicine as she was directed to do.
Schedule another appointment with her doctor.
instances.correctAnswer: Take the medicine as she was directed to do.

variables.a: What does the man suggest the woman do?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Can you change the bill for me please?
M: Sure, 5, 10, 15, 20. OK, 20.
W: Can I have some coins? I need them for a phone call.
M: Here you are.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Can you change the bill for me please?
M: Sure, 5, 10, 15, 20. OK, 20.
W: Can I have some coins? I need them for a phone call.
M: Here you are.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: Can you change the bill for me please?
M: Sure, 5, 10, 15, 20. OK, 20.
W: Can I have some coins? I need them for a phone call.
M: Here you are.
{a}

answerOptions: The woman is paying the bill.
The woman has a 20-dollar bill changed.
The man pays 20 dollars to the woman.
instances.correctAnswer: The woman has a 20-dollar bill changed.

variables.a: What can we learn from this conversation?

answerOptions: She has an appointment with her friend.
She'll have an appointment with her friend.

variables.a: why can't the women go on Thursday?

answerOptions: The man can see a different view.
The food is not tasty enough.
The food is worth the price.
instances.correctAnswer: The food is worth the price.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?
What is the man going to buy?
What's the man doing?
Who hasn't brought the dictionary to class?
What are they talking about?

answerOptions: It is a hot and smoggy day.
There is a traffic jam on King Street.
A vehicle is polluting the air.
instances.correctAnswer: A vehicle is polluting the air.

variables.a: What can we learn from the conversation?

answerOptions: He will go to the airport to meet the woman.
He will reserve a hotel room for the woman.
He will help her find her way around.
instances.correctAnswer: He will help her find her way around.

variables.a: What does the man offer to do for the woman?
What will Sam do?

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Hurry up! We'll miss the train. Can't you run any faster?
M: Sorry, I'm going as fast as I can already.
W: OK. I guess you're quite a bit shorter than I am after all.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Hurry up! We'll miss the train. Can't you run any faster?
M: Sorry, I'm going as fast as I can already.
W: OK. I guess you're quite a bit shorter than I am after all.
{a}

{a}

answerOptions: They want to ca tch the train.
They don't want to be late for the party.
instances.correctAnswer: They want to ca tch the train.

variables.a: Why are they in such a hurry?
What is the man's telephone number?

answerOptions: Arranging a bed for a patient.
instances.correctAnswer: Arranging a bed for a patient.

variables.a: What are the speakers talking about?

answerOptions: The holiday passed quickly for him, too.
He's surprised to hear what the woman said.
The woman already told him about her holiday.
instances.correctAnswer: The holiday passed quickly for him, too.

variables.a: How does the man feel?
When will the plane leave?
What does the woman mean?
What are the speakers talking about?

answerOptions: The woman went to the man's house.
The woman was in her office.
The woman was on her way back home.
instances.correctAnswer: The woman went to the man's house.

variables.a: Why couldn't the man meet the woman at her house?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Sweety, let's go out for a walk.
M: It looks like rainy. How about going to a bar for a beer?
W: But I can't drink beer with the medicine I'm taking. Why not go to a movie?
M: I would rather watch a video online.
{a}

M: I would rather watch a video online.
{a}

variables.a: What will the man probably do?
How does the man feel about Jack's failing the exam?
